page.title: 09SAINT ALDHELM
page.content: In 705{King Ina}decided that his {Kingdom of Wessex}was too big for one {bishop}so he split it into two and made Aldhelm the{Bishop of Sherborne. Aldhelm was 70 then. Aldhelm decided that he would walk around his diocese to see what it was like.He used to sing hymns to attract people to his preaching and baptized a lot people in local streams. When he was on one of these trips he visited a pagan uncle of his who lived at{Cannards Grave which is about one mile from Doulting. During this stay he felt ill and realised he was going to die.He didn't want to die in a pagan house so he was carried to the wooden church at Doulting where he died in 709.The monks at{Glastonbury}allowed some people to build a church from{Doulting {stone}in Aldhelm's memory.
